summary: This is an email chain from October 9, 2020, among personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), an FBI agent, and a contractor, coordinating the handoff of a CD containing evidence for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails discuss finding a paralegal to receive the disc from an FBI agent and deliver it to IT.

persons.name: Eli
persons.role: Person expected to receive a disc
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will be receiving a disc from an FBI agent for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Coordination for CD handoff in Maxwell case
events.description: Email correspondence arranging for a paralegal/contractor to pick up a CD from an FBI agent and deliver it to IT for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, noting the task is time-sensitive.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated October 9, 2020, concerning evidence handling for the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case.
An FBI agent was planning to drop off a CD containing case evidence that needed to be delivered to IT.
The emails show coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), FBI personnel, and a contractor to facilitate this transfer, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
The task was described as 'time sensitive,' highlighting the urgency of processing the evidence.
The document references internal office logistics, such as staff working remotely and the need to find available personnel.
